00002 #ifndef TLM_PEQ_HEADER
00003 #define TLM_PEQ_HEADER

00005 #include <map>
00006 
00007 //#include "analysis.h"
00008 
00009 using std::multimap;
00010 using std::pair;
00011 
00012 using analysis::delayed_analysis_if;
00013 using analysis::analysis_port;
00014 
00015 //
00016 // No lt_sctime operator required, since we have operator< defined for
00017 // sc_time ?
00018 //
00019 // struct lt_sc_time {
00020 //  bool operator<( const sc_time &a , const sc_time &b ) {
00021 //    return a < b;
00022 //  }
00023 // };
00024 //
00025 //
00026 //
00027 
00028 //
00029 // This peq implements a delayed write and has an analysis port
00030 //
00031 // If you post many transactions to the same time slot, this will result in
00032 // many transactions coming out of the analysis port in a single delta
00033 //
00034 // If you want event driven semantics, stuff the output of the analysis port
00035 // into an analysis fifo ( if you want to guarantee no losses ) or
00036 // analysis buffer ( if you don't mind losses but you can't be bothered or are
00037 // not able to clear the fifo out ).
00038 //
00039 // For example, you can arrive at a blocking get interface by doing get on
00040 // an analysis fifo attached to the analysis port shown below
00041 //
00042 // We could even design a tlm_peq_fifo and/or tlm_peq_buffer with these
00043 // channels built in
00044 //
00045 
00046 template< typename T>
00047 class tlm_peq :
00048   public sc_module ,
00049   public virtual delayed_analysis_if< T >
00050 {
00051  public:
00052   sc_export< delayed_analysis_if< T > > delayed_analysis_export;
00053   analysis_port< T > ap;
00054 
00055   SC_HAS_PROCESS( tlm_peq );
00056 
00057   tlm_peq( sc_module_name nm ) : sc_module( nm ) , ap("ap") {
00058 
00059     delayed_analysis_export( *this );
00060 
00061     SC_METHOD( wake_up_method );
00062     dont_initialize();
00063     sensitive << m_wake_up;
00064 
00065   }
00066 
00067   int size() const { return m_map.size(); }
00068 
00069   int posted_before( const sc_time &time ) const {
00070 
00071     int i = 0;
00072 
00073     for( typename multimap< sc_time , T>::const_iterator iter = m_map.begin();
00074          iter != m_map.end();
00075          ++iter ) {
00076 
00077       if( (*iter).first < time ) {
00078         i++;
00079       }
00080 
00081     }
00082 
00083     return i;
00084 
00085   }
00086 
00087   int posted_at( const sc_time &time ) const {
00088     return m_map.count( time );
00089   }
00090 
00091   void write( const T &transaction , const sc_time &time ) {
00092 
00093     m_map.insert( pair_type( time + sc_time_stamp() , transaction ) );
00094     m_wake_up.notify( time );
00095 
00096   }
00097 
00098  private:
00099   typedef pair<sc_time,T> pair_type;
00100 
00101   void wake_up_method() {
00102 
00103     pair_type p;
00104     sc_time now = sc_time_stamp();
00105 
00106     // must be something there, and it must be scheduled for now
00107 
00108     assert( m_map.size() > 0 );
00109     assert( (*(m_map.begin())).first == now );
00110 
00111     for( p = *(m_map.begin());
00112          p.first == now;
00113          p = *(m_map.begin()) )
00114     {
00115 
00116       ap.write( p.second );
00117       m_map.erase( m_map.begin() );
00118 
00119       if( m_map.size() == 0 ) {
00120         return;
00121       }
00122 
00123       p = *(m_map.begin());
00124 
00125     }
00126 
00127     m_wake_up.notify( p.first - now );
00128 
00129   }
00130 
00131   sc_event m_wake_up;
00132   multimap< sc_time , T> m_map;
00133 
00134 };
00135 
00136 #endif
